description: Display NUMA memory statistics per node. Shows memory allocation, hits/misses, and foreign allocations. Critical for identifying NUMA imbalances that can impact HPC application performance.

installation.notes: Install via: apt install numactl or yum install numactl

global_options.description: Show per-node memory info (like /proc/meminfo per node)
Show per-node memory for specified PID or pattern

common_usage_patterns.output_example:
node0           node1
numa_hit               123456789       234567890
numa_miss                   1234            5678
numa_foreign                5678            1234
interleave_hit              1000            1000
local_node             123456789       234567890
other_node                  1234            5678

common_usage_patterns.description: Show memory usage for specific process

error_messages.meaning: Process not found or no permission
error_messages.resolution: Verify PID exists and you have permission

interoperability.notes: High numa_miss or other_node values indicate suboptimal memory placement. Applications should ideally have most allocations as numa_hit and local_node.

permissions.read_operations: No special permissions for system stats
permissions.notes: Reading other users' process stats may require root

limitations: Per-process stats require process to exist

consistent_with.shared_state: Total memory across nodes matches system total
